sent_1.text: Counselor and stimulus control enhancements of a stage-matched expert system intervention for smokers in a managed care setting .

sent_2.text: BACKGROUND Previous research has demonstrated the efficacy of an interactive expert system intervention for smoking cessation for a general population .

sent_3.text: The intervention provides individualized feedback that guides participants through the stages of change for cessation .

sent_4.text: Enhancing the expert system by adding proactive telephone counseling or a stimulus control computer designed to produce nicotine fading could produce preventive programs with greater population impacts .

sent_5.text: METHODS Four interventions were compared : ( a ) the interactive expert system intervention ; ( b ) the expert system intervention plus counselor calls ; ( c ) the

entity_10.text: expert system intervention plus counselor calls

sent_6.text: expert system intervention plus the stimulus control computer ; and ( d ) an assessment only condition .

entity_11.text: expert system intervention plus the stimulus control computer

sent_7.text: A 4 ( intervention ) x 4 ( occasions ) ( 0,6,12 , and 18 months ) design was used .

sent_8.text: Smokers were contacted at home via telephone or mail .

sent_9.text: The initial subject pool was the 24,178 members of a managed care company .

sent_10.text: Screening was completed for 19,236 members ( 79.6 % ) , of whom 4,653 were smokers ; 85.3 % of the smokers were enrolled .

sent_11.text: RESULTS Thirty-eight percent were in the precontemplation stage , 45 % in the contemplation stage , and only 17 % in the preparation stage .

sent_12.text: At 18 months , the expert system resulted in 23.2 % point prevalence abstinence , which was 33 % greater than that of assessment only .

sent_13.text: The counselor enhancement produced increased cessation at 12 months but not at 18 months .

sent_14.text: The stimulus control computer produced no improvement , resulting in 20 % worse cessation rates than the assessment only condition .

sent_15.text: CONCLUSIONS The enhanced conditions failed to outperform the expert system alone .

sent_16.text: The study also demonstrated the ability of the interactive expert system to produce significantly greater cessation in a population of smokers than assessment alone .
